content.body:
> <@rkirsling:matrix.org> in theory you could keep nesting `is ... if (...)`s

I think this point may have been overlooked in the discussion about `is` and `if`
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @rkirsling:matrix.org
in theory you could keep nesting is ... if (...)s
I think this point may have been overlooked in the discussion about is and if

content.body: this really is something that arises from the combination of the two
though I guess it's not exclusive to `if` _patterns_; it's mostly something that happens due to `is` existing
content.formatted_body: though I guess it's not exclusive to if patterns; it's mostly something that happens due to is existing

content.body: though as Ron mentioned immediately above, the spelling of `if` pattterns/guards as `if` is the compounding factors
